member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.IComponentRegistrar
member.summary: Defines a registration mechanism that converts configuration data into Autofac component registrations.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.IComponentRegistrar.RegisterConfiguredComponents(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Registers individual configured components into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.
member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the component configuration into registrations.

remarks.para: Implementations of this method are responsible for adding components to the container by parsing configuration model data and executing the registration logic.

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar
member.summary: Default component configuration processor.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar.RegisterConfiguredComponents(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Registers individual configured components into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.
member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the component configuration into registrations.

remarks.para: This is where the individually configured component registrations get added to the . The components collection from the get processed into individual registrations with associated lifetime scope, name, etc.
You may influence the process by overriding this whole method or by overriding individual parsing subroutines in this registrar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar.SetAutoActivate``2(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1})
member.summary: Sets the auto activation mode for the component.
member.param: The configuration data containing the component. The autoActivate content will be read from this configuration object and used to determine auto activation status.
The component registration on which auto activation mode is being set.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands , empty, or values (false, 0, no) to mean "not auto-activated" and values (true, 1, yes) to mean "auto activation should occur."
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for auto activation settings.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for autoActivate is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar.SetComponentOwnership``2(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1})
member.summary: Sets the ownership model for the component.
member.param: The configuration data containing the component. The ownership content will be read from this configuration object and used to determine component ownership.
The component registration on which component ownership is being set.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands or empty values to be "default ownership model"; lifetime-scope or LifetimeScope is "owned by lifetime scope"; and external or ExternallyOwned is "externally owned."
By default, this implementation understands the following grammar:
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for component ownership.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for ownership is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar.SetInjectProperties``2(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1})
member.summary: Sets the property injection mode for the component.
member.param: The configuration data containing the component. The injectProperties content will be read from this configuration object and used to determine property injection status.
The component registration on which the property injection mode is being set.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands , empty, or values (false, 0, no) to mean "no property injection" and values (true, 1, yes) to mean "property injection should occur."
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for property injection settings.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for injectProperties is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ComponentRegistrar.SetLifetimeScope``2(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1})
member.summary: Sets the lifetime scope for the component.
member.param: The configuration data containing the component. The instanceScope content will be read from this configuration object and used as the lifetime scope.
The component registration on which the lifetime scope is being set.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands the following grammar:

item.description: One instance per nested lifetime scope
One instance for each resolution call
One instance per request lifetime scope

remarks.para: You may override this method to extend the available grammar for lifetime scope.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for lifetime scope is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.summary: Converts configured parameter values into parameters that can be used during object resolution.

The key indicating the sub-element with the parameters. Usually this is parameters.

The key indicating the sub-element with the propeties. Usually this is properties.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationExtensions.GetType(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Loads a type by name.
member.param: The object containing the type value to load.
Name of the to load. This may be a partial type name or a fully-qualified type name.
The default to use in type resolution if is a partial type name.
member.returns: The resolved based on the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified can't be resolved as a fully-qualified type name and isn't a partial type name for a found in the .

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationExtensions.GetConfiguredParameterValue(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfigurationSection)
member.summary: Inspects a parameter/property value to determine if it's a scalar, list, or dictionary property and casts it appropriately.
member.param: The object containing the parameter/property value to parse.
member.returns: A value that can be type-converted and used during object resolution.

remarks.para: The Microsoft configuration model code sees arrays (lists) the same as a dictionary with numeric keys. We have to do some work to determine how to store the parsed configuration values so they can be converted appropriately at resolve time; and there's still an edge case where someone actually wanted a with sequential, zero-based numeric keys.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationExtensions.GetKeyName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the simple configuration key name from a full, colon-delimited configuration key name.
member.param: The full configuration key name, like configuration:full:key.
member.returns: The last segment in the colon-delimited full key name, like key.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterConfiguration(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Registers the contents of a configuration section into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.

remarks.para: This method is the primary entry point to configuration section registration. From here, the various modules, components, and referenced files get registered. You may override any of those behaviors for a custom registrar if you wish to extend registration behavior.

member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the module configuration into registrations.
